document.title: United States History II Content Standards

13A11CD08EB640F58AFA88A20B913EA1.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the federal government’s response to international terrorism in
the 21st century

73F813DB37FB43518E16F205E934B8E3.description:
Analyze some of the major technological and social trends and issues of the late 20th and early
21st centuries

947BEFECA0924A4985B4A944739443C0.description:
Analyze how the failure of communist economic policies and U.S.-sponsored resistance to
Soviet military and diplomatic initiatives contributed to the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989 the
dissolution of the Soviet Union in 1991, and the end of the Cold War.

544CD1D5CB2D4726818E78774B2AEFED.description:
Analyze the presidency of Ronald Reagan (1981-1989) and the rise of the conservative
movement in American politics

D1655F8A5F6843B4ABB67CD635C94D12.description: Analyze and evaluate the impact of economic liberalism on mid-20th century society

88CA75FD5FDF4744AC4F9ADB113C9276.description:
Analyze the important policies and events that took place
during the presidencies of John F. Kennedy , Lyndon Johnson, and Richard Nixon

80A0B8411AB446D8A2B665B6D3C88746.description:
Research and analyze issues related to race relations in the United States since the passage of
the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and the Voting Rights Act of 1965

7BBE88581BAE4ABCB06ECB588EAC9CE4.description:
Analyze the causes and course of one of the following
social and political movements (Women's, LGBTQ, disabled, environment, workers, Native Americans).

423E2ADD6DC84C2F9C802D5EE5A04667.description:
Research Massachusetts leaders for civil rights and the controversies over the racial
desegregation of public schools in the 1960s and 1970s

52084531BA50491E9869B657DEE4F603.description:
Evaluate accomplishments of the Civil Rights movement and how they served as a model for later feminist, disability, and
gender rights movements of the 20th and 21st centuries

B15B891AFFC443A1A2495FA99440FCA4.description:
Analyze resistance to integration in some white communities, protests to end
segregation, and Supreme Court decisions on civil rights.

CBEDCC523AD541299776DBBD05E33035.description: Analyze the origins, evolution, and goals of the African American Civil Rights Movement

5686929417284265AC4390ACEC26ECFB.description:
Analyze the causes and consequences of important domestic Cold War trends in the United
States

6B624EF8A56D4C7EAF1E2029382C920C.description: Analyze the roots of domestic communism and anti-communism in the 1950s

4FE32F1BAE5E45C5817E039EFB108DF6.description: Research and analyze one the domestic policies of Presidents Truman and Eisenhower

8D1DE18EC01C4DEB9D0A8794970A3720.description:
Defending democracy: the Cold War and civil rights at
home

5B78CD3D6E1240F3937F12221FCAD0A1.description:
Summarize the diplomatic and military policies on the War in Vietnam of Presidents Eisenhower,
John F. Kennedy, Lyndon Johnson, and Richard Nixon and explain the intended and unintended
consequences of the Vietnam War the Vietnamese and Americans.

2B179A392F8942BEA98050727D37A8D3.description:
Analyze Dwight D. Eisenhower’s response to the Soviet Union’s launching of Sputnik (1957) and
the nation’s increased commitment to space exploration and education in science.

7659FDABC2744D6AB508384F1118DA3F.description:
Explain what communism is as an economic system and analyze the sources of Cold War
conflict; on a political map of the world, locate the areas of Cold War conflict between the U.S.
and the Soviet Union in the 1950s to the 1980s.

0100EC9B665E4EFC94AEF05B98AB4156.description:
Analyze the factors that contributed to the Cold War and describe the policy of containment as a
response by the United States to Soviet expansionist policies

71E5CBB108A648E786621DA3C426CD39.description: Explain the long-term consequences of important domestic events during the war.

9F1099E795D44E87BB3B8F2E474644D1.description:
Explain the reasons the United States gave for the use of atomic bombs at Hiroshima and
Nagasaki in Japan; and use primary and secondary sources to analyze how arguments for and
against the use of nuclear weapons developed from the late 1940s to the early 1960s.

0137D5127EC54346AE76888A281B5B78.description:
Describe the Allied response to the persecution of the Jews by the Nazis before, during, and
after the war.

36BC98CAA5794463901FF6724278110A.description:
Analyze one of the events that led to World War II, one of the major battles of the war and its
consequences, or one of the conferences of Allied leaders following the war

6633935F273649BAADC763DA4B1B3678.description:
On a map of the world, locate the Allied powers at the time of World War II (Britain, France,
the Soviet Union, and the United States) and Axis powers (Germany, Italy, and Japan).

919C570CDA0843BC9C62B97A0165FB17.description:
Explain the reasons for American involvement in World War II and the key actions and events
leading up to declarations of war against Japan and Germany

3107C05E8C1249A19E9490524AE37719.description:
Explain the rise of fascism and the forms it took in Germany and Italy, including ideas and
policies that led to the Holocaust.

75FE48CB4CEB41338F19EFE9BC58CB46.description:
Develop an argument which analyzes the effectiveness of American isolationism and analyzes
the impact of isolationism on U.S. foreign policy

8437B6EC84744D8DAEA3E0EDE77B09B3.description:
Defending democracy: responses to fascism and
communism

E915EC981ABE4B49BC63B7AB8ED04567.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the New Deal programs enacted during the 1930s and the societal
responses to those programs.

EA8D3BD1F2C94DABA1CEE8DE1592CB2C.description:
Analyze the important policies, institutions, trends, and personalities
of the Depression era

A5540B7DDF154BFFB37F9DC9B866C834.description:
Gather, evaluate, and analyze primary sources (e.g., economic data, articles, diaries,
photographs, audio and video recordings, songs, movies, and literary works) to create an oral,
media, or written report on how Americans responded to the Great Depression.

1323B74C2C2148E0905924DD8771C482.description:
Describe the multiple causes (e.g., fall in stock market and commodities prices, restrictive
monetary and trade policies, post-war reparations and debt) and consequences of the global
depression of the 1930s

3E1EFED3FE154BDAA4C8C44F32AA6D2B.description:
Develop an argument about how the conflict between traditionalism and
modernity manifested itself in the major societal trends and events in first two decades of
the 20th century.

E8C0E104F3AF45769CC3A3274832C717.description:
Modernity in the United States: ideologies and
economies

3EC3562B05244077B490137407166544.description:
Analyze how the government uses taxing and spending decisions (fiscal policy) and monetary
policy to promote price stability, full employment, and economic growth.

7FAA3900DEC642D58DC584B346B2449E.description:
Explain and give examples of the roles that government may play in a market economy,
including the provision of public goods and services, redistribution of income, protection of
property rights, and resolution of market failures.

19146A53D7214B8CB98374A68E38B1D3.description: Analyze the impact of events such as wars and technological developments on business cycles.

BBD34FD967B54CD69437FFE8F8815425.description:
Explain how a country’s overall level of income, employment, and prices are determined by the
individual spending and production decisions of households and firms, and that government
measures such as Gross Domestic Product (GDP) describe these factors at the national level.

DEB57CF9F5094E3B922B7491EBC29A46.description:
Describe the organization and functions of the Federal Reserve System; explain the reason the
government established it in 1913 and analyze how it uses monetary tools to promote price
stability, full employment, and economic growth.

3DB37BECC5CD4882A828F48B47F3A2D9.description:
Explain the role of banks and other financial institutions in the market economy of the United
States, and analyze the reasons for banking crises.

FE91E100CB1542D1AC822B5E53D87ADA.description:
Explain how buyers and sellers in financial markets determine the prices of financial assets and
therefore influence the rate of return on those assets.

4A4E8481AEA84ABB8F3DF8DF25B59E2F.description:
Explain what a financial investment is (e.g., a bank deposit, stocks, bonds, mutual funds, real
estate); explain why the value of investments fluctuate, and track the gains or losses in value of
a financial investment over time (e.g., stocks, bonds, or mutual funds)

C63398653C744A87AE6C71B073B6C125.description:
Define supply and demand and explain the role that supply and demand, prices, and profits play
in determining production and distribution in a market economy

67A49B8DAAAE4676919C9A9E993AD413.description:
Explain that the goals of economic policy may be to promote freedom, efficiency, equity,
security, growth, price stability, and full employment and that different economic systems place
greater emphasis on some goals over others

EB20DC4EE9944CD7936B81AED836852C.description:
Describe how resources for the production of goods are limited, therefore people must make
choices to gain some things and give up others.

DB25A7573FDE404599B43CA536349491.description: The role of economics in modern United States history
